channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Olympics Have Arrived
item.description: The Games present untold opportunities to geek out on sports you haven’t thought about for several years, or ever.

item.title: Olympics Medals: Latest Results for the Paris Olympics by Country
item.description: The latest medal count and results for the Paris Olympics.

item.title: Specialists in relocating Americans to Europe and Canada are seeing the phone ringing off the hook since the Trump vs Biden debate
item.description: "If you're no longer working and you could choose to live anywhere in the world, why would you choose to live in the U.S. now?"

item.title: Kamala Harris Is Known Abroad for a Personal Touch, and Tough Talk
item.description: Heads of state and diplomats who have interacted with the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee say she uses humor, and talk of food, to help leaven hard discussions.

item.title: Opening Ceremony Highlights: Celine Dion Caps Celebration Along Seine Hours After Rail Chaos
item.description: The sprawling ceremony was held under rainy skies and featured sports stars like Zinedine Zidane and Serena Williams. Earlier, coordinated arson attacks disrupted service on three high-speed links to Paris, causing severe delays.

item.title: New Yorkers immediately protest new AI-based weapons detectors on subways
item.description: “It’s not going to work," said Dre Thomas, 25, shaking his head at the device.

item.title: 5 Excerpts From JD Vance’s Emails to a Transgender Classmate
item.description: A former Yale Law School classmate shared with The Times about 90 emails and text messages with Mr. Vance. Here are some of the most revealing moments in their correspondence.

item.title: Kamala Harris Is Known Abroad for a Personal Touch, and Tough Talk
item.description: Heads of state and diplomats who have interacted with the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee say she uses humor, and talk of food, to help leaven hard discussions.

item.title: General Motors, Honda, and Hyundai are accused of inappropriately selling customer data
item.description: Verisk used the data to prepare reports on driving-behavior history and sold them to insurance companies, two senators alleged.

item.title: What to Know About Kamala Harris’s Foreign Policy Positions
item.description: Here is what we know about the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee’s views on issues like migration and the wars in Ukraine and Gaza.

item.title: More Trains, but Few Answers, After Railway Sabotage in France
item.description: France’s national railway company said traffic was gradually returning to normal a day after arsonists disrupted three high-speed rail lines. No one has claimed responsibility for the attacks.

item.title: Mass exodus in Mexico after cartel violence intensifies
item.description: Two of Mexico’s most powerful cartels from the northern states of Sinaloa and Jalisco have been battling for control of smuggling routes.

item.title: The Top 3 Mistakes To Avoid With Your 401(k)
item.description: Here is what experts say are the costliest stumbles people make with their retirement savings accounts — and how to get back on course.

item.title: What to Know About Kamala Harris’s Foreign Policy Positions
item.description: Here is what we know about the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee’s views on issues like migration and the wars in Ukraine and Gaza.

item.title: A 59-year-old widow has been forced to use a breathing tube and skyrocketing demand for wood pellets in the EU might be to blame
item.description: Wood pellet production is feeding demand for renewable energy in the EU, but it's taking a toll on Americans' health.
